item.title: Stability Analysis of ODEs
item.description: 1. Linear Systems Link to heading 1.1Autonomous System An autonomous System of Ordinary Differential Equations is a system which does NOT explicitly depend on the independent variables. It is of the form $$ \frac{d}{dt} x(t) = f(x(t))\hspace{0.15cm}; \hspace{0.5cm} x \in \mathbb{R}^n $$ Solutions are invariant under horizontal translations. Proof: Say, $x_1(t)$ is a solution of the ODE $\frac{dx}{dt} = f(x)$, $x(0) = x_0$.\ Then $x_2(t) = x_1(t-t_0)$ solves $\frac{dx}{dt} = f(x)$, $x(t_0) = x_0$.
